dfischer.utils

Class ParseArgs

  • java.lang.Object
    • dfischer.utils.ParseArgs

  • public class ParseArgs
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility: Parses arguments of console programs.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static boolean askBoolean(java.lang.String question, java.lang.String[] yes, java.lang.String[] no, boolean defaultValue)
      Allows to read a boolean input value from console input.
      static java.lang.String getIgnoreCaseString(java.lang.String[] args, java.lang.String parameter)
      Returns the value of an program argument (case insensitive) as String.
      static java.lang.Integer getInteger(java.lang.String[] args, java.lang.String parameter)
      Returns the value of an program argument as Integer.

      Does the same as the method getInteger() but asks the user if a particular argument was not specified at program start.

    • Method Detail

      • hasOption

        public static boolean hasOption(java.lang.String[] args,
                java.lang.String option)
        Checks if the program has been started with a particular option.
        Parameters:
        args - list of all arguments from "public static void main(String[] args)"
        option - option to search inside the program arguments
        Returns:
        true if the option was found

      • hasIgnoreCaseOption

        public static boolean hasIgnoreCaseOption(java.lang.String[] args,
                          java.lang.String option)
        Checks if the program has been started with a particular option (case insensitive).
        Parameters:
        args - list of all arguments from "public static void main(String[] args)"
        option - option to search inside the program arguments (case insensitive)
        Returns:
        true if the option was found

      • getString

        public static java.lang.String getString(java.lang.String[] args,
                         java.lang.String parameter)
        Returns the value of an program argument as String. Parameter names and values are separated by a white space.
        Parameters:
        args - list of all arguments from "public static void main(String[] args)"
        parameter - name of argument
        Returns:
        value of argument or null if the argument name or its value was not found

        parameter - name of argument

      • getLastLong

        public static java.lang.Long getLastLong(java.lang.String[] args,
                         java.lang.String parameter)
        Returns the last occurrence of an program argument as Long. Parameter names and values are separated by a white space.
        Parameters:
        args - list of all arguments from "public static void main(String[] args)"
        parameter - name of argument
        Returns:
        value of argument (last occurrence if the same argument is set multiple times) or null if the argument name or its value was not found

      • askBoolean

        public static boolean askBoolean(java.lang.String question,
                 java.lang.String[] yes,
                 java.lang.String[] no,
                 boolean defaultValue)
        Allows to read a boolean input value from console input.
        Parameters:
        question - question text
        yes - the method will return true if one of these strings match to the response (case insensitive)
        no - the method will return false if one of these strings match to the response (case insensitive)
        defaultValue - default value if only (empty string) has been given as input
        Returns:
        the boolean input value

      • getStringOrAsk

        public static java.lang.String getStringOrAsk(java.lang.String[] args,
                              java.lang.String parameter,
                              java.lang.String question,
                              java.lang.String defaultValue)
        Does the same as the method getString() but asks the user if a particular argument was not specified at program start.
        Parameters:
        args - list of all arguments from "public static void main(String[] args)"
        parameter - name of argument
        question - question text presented to the user if the argument was not specified at program start
        defaultValue - default value of user's response
        Returns:
        value of argument
        See Also:
        getString(java.lang.String[], java.lang.String)

      • getIntegerOrAsk

        public static java.lang.Integer getIntegerOrAsk(java.lang.String[] args,
                                java.lang.String parameter,
                                java.lang.String question,
                                java.lang.Integer defaultValue)
        Does the same as the method getInteger() but asks the user if a particular argument was not specified at program start.
        Parameters:
        args - list of all arguments from "public static void main(String[] args)"
        parameter - name of argument
        question - question text presented to the user if the argument was not specified at program start
        defaultValue - default value of user's response
        Returns:
        value of argument
        See Also:
        getInteger(java.lang.String[], java.lang.String)
